medi:segment.name: General indicator
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the whole message.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify relevant parties for the whole transaction.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the name and address and the related function of the party involved.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the references of the party identified in the leading NAD.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the message transaction date, accounting period, accounting year, accounting periodicity.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
FTX, A segment to provide general message information, and/or narrative descriptions of references or account period given.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify accounting breakdowns within the contract.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment to specify the account rendering currency (statement currency) of the sub-account, and if required the settlement currency and the exchange rate used to convert from original account currency into settlement currency.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment used to tie the sub-account to a specific reference and to additionally identify the layer or surplus number of the contract for which data are rendered.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment used to provide free text information regarding the contract section reported in the sub-account (particularly for facultative contracts).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify accounting entries for the sub-account, and if required the sub-account balance(s).

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the accounting entries or the sub- account balance(s).

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify pertinent dates and periods relating to the entry.

medi:segment.name: Percentage details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCD, A segment to specify the percentage used to calculate the entry, and/or the receiver's share percentage.

medi:segment.name: General indicator
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIS, A segment to give an indicator to specify the way to process the entry.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment to identify the geographical scope to which the entry pertains or - for facultative accounts - the location of the risk.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment used to provide free text information regarding the entry. More particularly, the segment can be used to give loss details or additional information concerning bucket entry codes.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to refer to supporting messages or documents. The segment may equally be used in case of loss amount reporting to specify the event reference.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference to a supporting document or message and/or (in case of losses reported), the event reference.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date of transaction of the supporting document or message.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment to identify the means by which the referenced document or message was transmitted.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment used to provide free text information regarding the document or message that is referenced.

medi:segment.name: Section control
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
UNS, A segment used to prevent collisions between the detail and the summary sections of the message.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments that may be used to specify account totals and subdivide them per type of settlement. At the same type this group can be used to break down the account into sub-balances using various criteria, such as collectable or non-collectable, and the embedded group 6 can be used to make breakdowns per party in the underlying market.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the total account balances per settlement currency, or the possible breakdowns e.g. the amounts due in instalments, or per payment means or combined.

medi:segment.name: General indicator
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the settlement.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments used to make breakdowns of the amount reported, per party in the underlying market.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the bank where the letter of credit was issued, the payer's and beneficiary's bank, the assuming company, the multiple cedants involved.

medi:segment.name: Percentage details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCD, A segment used to specify the share of the party in the broker's order or in the 100% of the contract, expressed as a percentage.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the references of the party named in the leading NAD.

medi:segment.name: General indicator
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the settlement by specific parties involved in the transaction.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the share amount of the party specified.

medi:segment.name: Payment instructions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAI, A segment to specify the means of settlement.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to specify references related to the settlement of the account balance.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify pertinent dates and periods relating to the settlement of the RETACC.
